attributes.comment:
What "security" measures could possibly require such an hightening of fees?

What "security" measures are actually needed and how are the current "security"
measures working?

There is a multitude of countries around the world where the standard of living
is better than in the US and society is in many ways more functional. The world
does not look toward the US as being heaven on earth, and such notions should be
cleared from the minds of those that seem to be infested with them.

It saddens me to see the ignorant view of a few US Citizens which have
previously posted comments on to the proposed price hike proclaiming that "US
residency and citizenship is invaluable", or that the "price should be raised to
make the illegal immigrants bear the costs they incurr"(The several comments
into that notion I've read puzzle me as the USCIS will generally not be dealing
with forms from illegal immigrants). Please wake up and smell the coffee, we may
be in a good part of the world, but we are not best and not superior. Arrogance
is not an honorable trait.

To end this comment then I object to the high level of price increases.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Patrick Mahoney
